name: Handshake
description: This causes the server to switch into the target state.

name: Legacy Server List Ping
description: This packet uses a nonstandard format. It is never length-prefixed, and the packet ID is an Unsigned Byte instead of a VarInt.

name: Status Response
description: The status can only be requested once immediately after the handshake, before any ping. The server won't respond otherwise.

name: Ping Response
description: The status can only be requested once immediately after the handshake, before any ping. The server won't respond otherwise.

name: Status Request
description: The status can only be requested once immediately after the handshake, before any ping. The server won't respond otherwise.

name: Ping Request
description: The login process is as follows:

name: Disconnect (login)
description: See Protocol Encryption for details.

name: Encryption Request
description: See Protocol Encryption for details.

name: Login Success
description: Enables compression.  If compression is enabled, all following packets are encoded in the compressed packet format.  Negative values will disable compression, meaning the packet format should remain in the uncompressed packet format.  However, this packet is entirely optional, and if not sent, compression will also not be enabled (the notchian server does not send the packet when compression is disabled).

name: Set Compression
description: Enables compression.  If compression is enabled, all following packets are encoded in the compressed packet format.  Negative values will disable compression, meaning the packet format should remain in the uncompressed packet format.  However, this packet is entirely optional, and if not sent, compression will also not be enabled (the notchian server does not send the packet when compression is disabled).

name: Login Plugin Request
description: Used to implement a custom handshaking flow together with Login Plugin Response.

name: Login Start
description: See Protocol Encryption for details. See Mojang_API#Player_Certificates for an API to get the message signature.

name: Encryption Response
description: See Protocol Encryption for details. See Mojang_API#Player_Certificates for an API to get the message signature.

name: Login Plugin Response
description: In Notchian server, the maximum data length is 1048576 bytes.

name: Login Acknowledged
description: Acknowledgement to the Login Success packet sent by the server.

name: Plugin Message (configuration)
description: Mods and plugins can use this to send their data. Minecraft itself uses several plugin channels. These internal channels are in the minecraft namespace.

name: Disconnect (configuration)
description: Sent by the server to notify the client that the configuration process has finished. The client answers with its own Finish Configuration whenever it is ready to continue.

name: Finish Configuration
description: Sent by the server to notify the client that the configuration process has finished. The client answers with its own Finish Configuration whenever it is ready to continue.

name: Keep Alive (configuration)
description: The server will frequently send out a keep-alive, each containing a random ID. The client must respond with the same payload (see serverbound Keep Alive). If the client does not respond to them for over 30 seconds, the server kicks the client. Vice versa, if the server does not send any keep-alives for 20 seconds, the client will disconnect and yields a "Timed out" exception.

name: Ping (configuration)
description: Packet is not used by the Notchian server. When sent to the client, client responds with a Pong packet with the same id.

name: Registry Data
description: Represents certain registries that are sent from the server and are applied on the client.

name: Resource Pack
description: Used to enable and disable features, generally experimental ones, on the client.

name: Feature Flags
description: Used to enable and disable features, generally experimental ones, on the client.

name: Update Tags
description: Tags look like:

name: Client Information (configuration)
description: Sent when the player connects, or when settings are changed.

name: Plugin Message (configuration)
description: Mods and plugins can use this to send their data. Minecraft itself uses some plugin channels. These internal channels are in the minecraft namespace.

name: Finish Configuration
description: Sent by the client to notify the client that the configuration process has finished. It is sent in response to the server's Finish Configuration.

name: Keep Alive (configuration)
description: The server will frequently send out a keep-alive (see clientbound Keep Alive), each containing a random ID. The client must respond with the same packet.

name: Pong (configuration)
description: Response to the clientbound packet (Ping) with the same id.

name: Resource Pack (configuration)
description: The delimiter for a bundle of packets. When received, the client should store every subsequent packet it receives, and wait until another delimiter is received. Once that happens, the client is guaranteed to process every packet in the bundle on the same tick.

name: Bundle Delimiter
description: The delimiter for a bundle of packets. When received, the client should store every subsequent packet it receives, and wait until another delimiter is received. Once that happens, the client is guaranteed to process every packet in the bundle on the same tick.

name: Spawn Entity
description: Sent by the server when an entity (aside from Experince Orb) is created.

name: Spawn Experience Orb
description: Spawns one or more experience orbs.

name: Entity Animation
description: Sent whenever an entity should change animation.

name: Award Statistics
description: Sent as a response to Client Command (id 1). Will only send the changed values if previously requested.

name: Acknowledge Block Change
description: Acknowledges a user-initiated block change. After receiving this packet, the client will display the block state sent by the server instead of the one predicted by the client.

name: Set Block Destroy Stage
description: 0–9 are the displayable destroy stages and each other number means that there is no animation on this coordinate.

name: Block Entity Data
description: Sets the block entity associated with the block at the given location.

name: Block Action
description: This packet is used for a number of actions and animations performed by blocks, usually non-persistent.  The client ignores the provided block type and instead uses the block state in their world.

name: Block Update
description: Fired whenever a block is changed within the render distance.

name: Boss Bar
description: Changes the difficulty setting in the client's option menu

name: Change Difficulty
description: Changes the difficulty setting in the client's option menu

name: Chunk Batch Finished
description: Marks the end of a chunk batch. The Notchian client marks the time it receives this packet and calculates the ellapsed duration since the beggining of the chunk batch. The server uses this duration and the batch size received in this packet to estimate the number of milliseconds ellapsed per chunk received. This value is then used to calculate the desired number of chunks per tick through the formula 25 / millisPerChunk, which is reported to the server through Chunk Batch Received.

name: Chunk Batch Start
description: Marks the start of a chunk batch. The Notchian client marks and stores the time it receives this packet.

name: Chunk Biomes
description: Clear the client's current title information, with the option to also reset it.

name: Clear Titles
description: Clear the client's current title information, with the option to also reset it.

name: Command Suggestions Response
description: The server responds with a list of auto-completions of the last word sent to it. In the case of regular chat, this is a player username. Command names and parameters are also supported. The client sorts these alphabetically before listing them.

name: Commands
description: Lists all of the commands on the server, and how they are parsed.

name: Close Container
description: This packet is sent from the server to the client when a window is forcibly closed, such as when a chest is destroyed while it's open. The notchian client disregards the provided window ID and closes any active window.

name: Set Container Content
description: Sent by the server when items in multiple slots (in a window) are added/removed. This includes the main inventory, equipped armour and crafting slots. This packet with Window ID set to "0" is sent during the player joining sequence to initialise the player's inventory.

name: Set Container Property
description: This packet is used to inform the client that part of a GUI window should be updated.

name: Set Container Slot
description: Sent by the server when an item in a slot (in a window) is added/removed.

name: Set Cooldown
description: Applies a cooldown period to all items with the given type.  Used by the Notchian server with enderpearls.  This packet should be sent when the cooldown starts and also when the cooldown ends (to compensate for lag), although the client will end the cooldown automatically. Can be applied to any item, note that interactions still get sent to the server with the item but the client does not play the animation nor attempt to predict results (i.e block placing).

name: Chat Suggestions
description: Unused by the Notchian server. Likely provided for custom servers to send chat message completions to clients.

name: Plugin Message
description: Mods and plugins can use this to send their data. Minecraft itself uses several plugin channels. These internal channels are in the minecraft namespace.

name: Damage Event
description: Removes a message from the client's chat. This only works for messages with signatures, system messages cannot be deleted with this packet.

name: Delete Message
description: Removes a message from the client's chat. This only works for messages with signatures, system messages cannot be deleted with this packet.

name: Disconnect (play)
description: Sent by the server before it disconnects a client. The client assumes that the server has already closed the connection by the time the packet arrives.

name: Disguised Chat Message
description: Used to send system chat messages to the client.

name: Entity Event
description: Entity statuses generally trigger an animation for an entity.  The available statuses vary by the entity's type (and are available to subclasses of that type as well).

name: Explosion
description: Sent when an explosion occurs (creepers, TNT, and ghast fireballs).

name: Unload Chunk
description: Tells the client to unload a chunk column.

name: Game Event
description: Used for a wide variety of game events, from weather to bed use to game mode to demo messages.

name: Open Horse Screen
description: This packet is used exclusively for opening the horse GUI. Open Screen is used for all other GUIs.  The client will not open the inventory if the Entity ID does not point to an horse-like animal.

name: Hurt Animation
description: Plays a bobbing animation for the entity receiving damage.

name: Initialize World Border
description: The Notchian client determines how solid to display the warning by comparing to whichever is higher, the warning distance or whichever is lower, the distance from the current diameter to the target diameter or the place the border will be after warningTime seconds. In pseudocode:

name: Keep Alive
description: The server will frequently send out a keep-alive, each containing a random ID. The client must respond with the same payload (see serverbound Keep Alive). If the client does not respond to them for over 30 seconds, the server kicks the client. Vice versa, if the server does not send any keep-alives for 20 seconds, the client will disconnect and yields a "Timed out" exception.

name: Chunk Data and Update Light
description: This packet sends all block entities in the chunk (though sending them is not required; it is still legal to send them with Block Entity Data later). The light data in this packet is the same format as in the Update Light packet.

name: World Event
description: Sent when a client is to play a sound or particle effect.

name: Particle
description: Displays the named particle

name: Update Light
description: Updates light levels for a chunk.  See Light for information on how lighting works in Minecraft.

name: Login (play)
description: See Protocol Encryption for information on logging in.

name: Map Data
description: Updates a rectangular area on a map item.

name: Merchant Offers
description: The list of trades a villager NPC is offering.

name: Update Entity Position
description: This packet is sent by the server when an entity moves less then 8 blocks; if an entity moves more than 8 blocks Teleport Entity should be sent instead.

name: Update Entity Position and Rotation
description: This packet is sent by the server when an entity rotates and moves. Since a short range is limited from -32768 to 32767, and movement is offset of fixed-point numbers, this packet allows at most 8 blocks movement in any direction. (-32768 / (32 * 128) == -8)

name: Update Entity Rotation
description: This packet is sent by the server when an entity rotates.

name: Move Vehicle
description: Note that all fields use absolute positioning and do not allow for relative positioning.

name: Open Book
description: Sent when a player right clicks with a signed book. This tells the client to open the book GUI.

name: Open Screen
description:
This is sent to the client when it should open an inventory, such as a chest, workbench, furnace, or other container. This message is not sent anywhere for clients opening their own inventory. Resending this packet with already existing window id, will update the window title and window type without closing the window.
For horses, use Open Horse Screen.

name: Open Sign Editor
description: Sent when the client has placed a sign and is allowed to send Update Sign.  There must already be a sign at the given location (which the client does not do automatically) - send a Block Update first.

name: Ping (play)
description: Packet is not used by the Notchian server. When sent to the client, client responds with a Pong packet with the same id.

name: Ping Response (play)
description: Response to the serverbound packet (Place Recipe), with the same recipe ID. Appears to be used to notify the UI.

name: Place Ghost Recipe
description: Response to the serverbound packet (Place Recipe), with the same recipe ID. Appears to be used to notify the UI.

name: Player Abilities
description: The latter 2 floats are used to indicate the flying speed and field of view respectively, while the first byte is used to determine the value of 4 booleans.

name: Player Chat Message
description: Sends the client a message from a player.

name: End Combat
description: Unused by the Notchian client.  This data was once used for twitch.tv metadata circa 1.8.

name: Enter Combat
description: Unused by the Notchian client.  This data was once used for twitch.tv metadata circa 1.8.

name: Combat Death
description: Used to send a respawn screen.

name: Player Info Remove
description: Used by the server to remove players from the player list.

name: Player Info Update
description: Sent by the server to update the user list (<tab> in the client).

name: Look At
description: Used to rotate the client player to face the given location or entity (for /teleport [<targets>] <x> <y> <z> facing).

name: Synchronize Player Position
description: Updates the player's position on the server. This packet will also close the “Downloading Terrain” screen when joining/respawning.

name: Update Recipe Book
description: Action:

name: Remove Entities
description: Sent by the server when an entity is to be destroyed on the client.

name: Remove Entity Effect
description: To change the player's dimension (overworld/nether/end), send them a respawn packet with the appropriate dimension, followed by prechunks/chunks for the new dimension, and finally a position and look packet. You do not need to unload chunks, the client will do it automatically.

name: Resource Pack
description: To change the player's dimension (overworld/nether/end), send them a respawn packet with the appropriate dimension, followed by prechunks/chunks for the new dimension, and finally a position and look packet. You do not need to unload chunks, the client will do it automatically.

name: Respawn
description: To change the player's dimension (overworld/nether/end), send them a respawn packet with the appropriate dimension, followed by prechunks/chunks for the new dimension, and finally a position and look packet. You do not need to unload chunks, the client will do it automatically.

name: Set Head Rotation
description: Changes the direction an entity's head is facing.

name: Update Section Blocks
description: Fired whenever 2 or more blocks are changed within the same chunk on the same tick.

name: Select Advancements Tab
description: Sent by the server to indicate that the client should switch advancement tab. Sent either when the client switches tab in the GUI or when an advancement in another tab is made.

name: Server Data
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Action Bar Text
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Border Center
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Border Lerp Size
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Border Size
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Border Warning Delay
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Border Warning Distance
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Camera
description: Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.

name: Set Held Item
description: Sent to change the player's slot selection.

name: Set Center Chunk
description: Updates the client's location.  This is used to determine what chunks should remain loaded and if a chunk load should be ignored; chunks outside of the view distance may be unloaded.

name: Set Render Distance
description: Sent by the integrated singleplayer server when changing render distance.  This packet is sent by the server when the client reappears in the overworld after leaving the end.

name: Set Default Spawn Position
description: Sent by the server after login to specify the coordinates of the spawn point (the point at which players spawn at, and which the compass points to). It can be sent at any time to update the point compasses point at.

name: Display Objective
description: This is sent to the client when it should display a scoreboard.

name: Set Entity Metadata
description: Updates one or more metadata properties for an existing entity. Any properties not included in the Metadata field are left unchanged.

name: Link Entities
description: This packet is sent when an entity has been leashed to another entity.

name: Set Entity Velocity
description: Velocity is in units of 1/8000 of a block per server tick (50ms); for example, -1343 would move (-1343 / 8000) = −0.167875 blocks per tick (or −3.3575 blocks per second).

name: Set Equipment
description: Sent by the server when the client should change experience levels.

name: Set Experience
description: Sent by the server when the client should change experience levels.

name: Set Health
description: Sent by the server to set the health of the player it is sent to.

name: Update Objectives
description: This is sent to the client when it should create a new scoreboard objective or remove one.

name: Set Passengers
description: Creates and updates teams.

name: Update Teams
description: Creates and updates teams.

name: Update Score
description: This is sent to the client when it should update a scoreboard item.

name: Set Simulation Distance
description: Time is based on ticks, where 20 ticks happen every second. There are 24000 ticks in a day, making Minecraft days exactly 20 minutes long.

name: Set Subtitle Text
description: Time is based on ticks, where 20 ticks happen every second. There are 24000 ticks in a day, making Minecraft days exactly 20 minutes long.

name: Update Time
description: Time is based on ticks, where 20 ticks happen every second. There are 24000 ticks in a day, making Minecraft days exactly 20 minutes long.

name: Set Title Text
description: Plays a sound effect from an entity, either by hardcoded ID or Identifier. Sound IDs and names can be found here.

name: Set Title Animation Times
description: Plays a sound effect from an entity, either by hardcoded ID or Identifier. Sound IDs and names can be found here.

name: Entity Sound Effect
description: Plays a sound effect from an entity, either by hardcoded ID or Identifier. Sound IDs and names can be found here.

name: Sound Effect
description: Plays a sound effect at the given location, either by hardcoded ID or Identifier. Sound IDs and names can be found here.

name: Start Configuration
description: Sent during gameplay in order to redo the configuration process. The client must respond with Configuration Acknowledged for the process to start.

name: Stop Sound
description: Categories:

name: System Chat Message
description: Identifying the difference between Chat/System Message is important as it helps respect the user's chat visibility options.  See processing chat for more info about these positions.

name: Set Tab List Header And Footer
description: This packet may be used by custom servers to display additional information above/below the player list. It is never sent by the Notchian server.

name: Tag Query Response
description: Sent in response to Query Block Entity Tag or Query Entity Tag.

name: Pickup Item
description: Sent by the server when someone picks up an item lying on the ground — its sole purpose appears to be the animation of the item flying towards you. It doesn't destroy the entity in the client memory, and it doesn't add it to your inventory. The server only checks for items to be picked up after each Set Player Position (and Set Player Position And Rotation) packet sent by the client. The collector entity can be any entity; it does not have to be a player. The collected entity also can be any entity, but the Notchian server only uses this for items, experience orbs, and the different varieties of arrows.

name: Teleport Entity
description: This packet is sent by the server when an entity moves more than 8 blocks.

name: Update Advancements
description: Advancement structure:

name: Update Attributes
description: Sets attributes on the given entity.

name: Entity Effect
description: Within flags:

name: Update Recipes
description: Recipe types:

name: Update Tags
description: Tags look like:

name: Confirm Teleportation
description: Sent by client as confirmation of Synchronize Player Position.

name: Query Block Entity Tag
description: Used when F3+I is pressed while looking at a block.

name: Change Difficulty
description: Must have at least op level 2 to use.  Appears to only be used on singleplayer; the difficulty buttons are still disabled in multiplayer.

name: Message Acknowledgment
description: Used to send a chat message to the server.  The message may not be longer than 256 characters or else the server will kick the client.

name: Chat Command
description: Used to send a chat message to the server.  The message may not be longer than 256 characters or else the server will kick the client.

name: Chat Message
description: Used to send a chat message to the server.  The message may not be longer than 256 characters or else the server will kick the client.

name: Player Session
description: Notifies the server that the chunk batch has been received by the client. The server uses the value sent in this packet to adjust the number of chunks to be sent in a batch.

name: Chunk Batch Received
description: Notifies the server that the chunk batch has been received by the client. The server uses the value sent in this packet to adjust the number of chunks to be sent in a batch.

name: Client Command
description: Action ID values:

name: Client Information
description: Sent when the player connects, or when settings are changed.

name: Command Suggestions Request
description: Sent when the client needs to tab-complete a minecraft:ask_server suggestion type.

name: Configuration Acknowledged
description: Sent by the client upon receiving a Start Configuration packet from the server.

name: Click Container Button
description: Used when clicking on window buttons.  Until 1.14, this was only used by enchantment tables.

name: Click Container
description: This packet is sent by the client when the player clicks on a slot in a window.

name: Close Container
description: This packet is sent by the client when closing a window.

name: Plugin Message
description: Mods and plugins can use this to send their data. Minecraft itself uses some plugin channels. These internal channels are in the minecraft namespace.

name: Edit Book
description: Used when F3+I is pressed while looking at an entity.

name: Query Entity Tag
description: Used when F3+I is pressed while looking at an entity.

name: Interact
description: This packet is sent from the client to the server when the client attacks or right-clicks another entity (a player, minecart, etc).

name: Jigsaw Generate
description: Sent when Generate is pressed on the Jigsaw Block interface.

name: Keep Alive
description: The server will frequently send out a keep-alive (see Clientbound Keep Alive), each containing a random ID. The client must respond with the same packet.

name: Lock Difficulty
description: Must have at least op level 2 to use.  Appears to only be used on singleplayer; the difficulty buttons are still disabled in multiplayer.

name: Set Player Position
description: Updates the player's XYZ position on the server.

name: Set Player Position and Rotation
description: A combination of Move Player Rotation and Move Player Position.

name: Set Player Rotation
description: Updates the direction the player is looking in.

name: Set Player On Ground
description: This packet as well as Set Player Position, Set Player Rotation, and Set Player Position and Rotation are called the “serverbound movement packets”. Vanilla clients will send Move Player Position once every 20 ticks even for a stationary player.

name: Move Vehicle
description: Sent when a player moves in a vehicle. Fields are the same as in Set Player Position and Rotation. Note that all fields use absolute positioning and do not allow for relative positioning.

name: Paddle Boat
description: Used to visually update whether boat paddles are turning.  The server will update the Boat entity metadata to match the values here.

name: Pick Item
description: Used to swap out an empty space on the hotbar with the item in the given inventory slot.  The Notchian client uses this for pick block functionality (middle click) to retrieve items from the inventory.

name: Ping Request (play)
description: This packet is sent when a player clicks a recipe in the crafting book that is craftable (white border).

name: Place Recipe
description: This packet is sent when a player clicks a recipe in the crafting book that is craftable (white border).

name: Player Abilities
description: The vanilla client sends this packet when the player starts/stops flying with the Flags parameter changed accordingly.

name: Player Action
description: Sent when the player mines a block. A Notchian server only accepts digging packets with coordinates within a 6-unit radius between the center of the block and 1.5 units from the player's feet (not their eyes).

name: Player Command
description: Sent by the client to indicate that it has performed certain actions: sneaking (crouching), sprinting, exiting a bed, jumping with a horse, and opening a horse's inventory while riding it.

name: Player Input
description: Also known as 'Input' packet.

name: Pong (play)
description: Response to the clientbound packet (Ping) with the same id.

name: Change Recipe Book Settings
description: Replaces Recipe Book Data, type 1.

name: Set Seen Recipe
description: Sent when recipe is first seen in recipe book. Replaces Recipe Book Data, type 0.

name: Rename Item
description: Sent as a player is renaming an item in an anvil (each keypress in the anvil UI sends a new Rename Item packet). If the new name is empty, then the item loses its custom name (this is different from setting the custom name to the normal name of the item). The item name may be no longer than 50 characters long, and if it is longer than that, then the rename is silently ignored.

name: Resource Pack
description: When a player selects a specific trade offered by a villager NPC.

name: Seen Advancements
description: When a player selects a specific trade offered by a villager NPC.

name: Select Trade
description: When a player selects a specific trade offered by a villager NPC.

name: Set Beacon Effect
description: Changes the effect of the current beacon.

name: Set Held Item
description: Sent when the player changes the slot selection

name: Program Command Block
description: While the user is in the standard inventory (i.e., not a crafting bench) in Creative mode, the player will send this packet.

name: Program Command Block Minecart
description: While the user is in the standard inventory (i.e., not a crafting bench) in Creative mode, the player will send this packet.

name: Set Creative Mode Slot
description: While the user is in the standard inventory (i.e., not a crafting bench) in Creative mode, the player will send this packet.

name: Program Jigsaw Block
description: Sent when Done is pressed on the Jigsaw Block interface.

name: Program Structure Block
description: Possible actions:

name: Update Sign
description: This message is sent from the client to the server when the “Done” button is pushed after placing a sign.

name: Swing Arm
description: Sent when the player's arm swings.

name: Teleport To Entity
description: Teleports the player to the given entity.  The player must be in spectator mode.

name: Use Item On
description: Upon placing a block, this packet is sent once.

name: Use Item
description: Sent when pressing the Use Item key (default: right click) with an item in hand.
